EXPERIENCE ETL TESTING 
Role :- Software Engineer(2014-2018) 
Technologies used:- Oracle,DB2,Netezza,UNIX,JIRA and Informatica 
Project Overview:- Starwood EDW is central data repository for all the 
applications which was consistently growing with new enhancements and 
data volume.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Managed a team of 7 people.
Responsible for validation of ETL processes using informatica 9.1
Analyzed and validated ETL and PL/SQL code enhancements
Created test approach and test design for releases.
Reviewed the test cases created by the team and provided 
suggestions to add
scenarios to cover negative testing.
Created test data for different scenarios for maximum coverage.
Executed Test cases in JIRA and attached proofs.
Defect logging and tracking in JIRA

STARWOOD - MARRIOTT INTEGRATION
Role :- Team Lead(2017-current) 
Technologies used:- Oracle,DB2, NETEZZA,Informatiaca,Cagnos,MSTR &
UNIX 
Project Overview:- The project is about migrating 196Tb of Starwood
hotel data to Marriott systems in support of the Marriott and Starwood
hotel merger. 

EXPERIENCE

RESPONSIBILITIES

Analyzed starwood and marriott warehouses and identified the
common points of integration. 
Created the mapping documents for each of the stages of data
migration and got it approved from the Business. 
Set up the conversion environment to felicitate the data migration
process between both the warehouses. 
Worked with clients in gathering business requirements for data
migration needs 
Developed new mappings to manipulate the data in the format
compatible with the target warehouse. 
Mitigate the issue well in advance and stopped them flowing to the 
production environment. 
Deploy the code to Lower and higher environment. 
Setting up the meetings with stake holders across and integrating the 
interim requirement changes into the mapping document and code. 
Conduct daily and weekly meetings with the team to ensure the timely
delivery. 
Perform migration and testing of static data and transaction data from
one core system to another. 
Normalize the De-normalized data from source DWH to move up to
OLTP system and push it down to target OLAP system.
Support deployment of solution, cut over planning and execution
activities 



EXPERIENCE

EXPERIENCE

EXADTA MIGRATION
Role :- Senior Software Engineer(2014-2016) 
Technologies used:- Oracle Exadata,Informatiaca,MSTR,UNIX and APX 
Project Overview:- project is to upgrade the hardware and software and
migrate the date from legacy system and Flat files to Exadat X-6 server
as a central reporting warehouse.

STARWOOD ETL & DWH DEVELOPER
Role :- Software Engineer(2011-2014) 
Technologies used:- Oracle Exadata,Informatiaca,MSTR,UNIX and APX 
Project Overview:- Starwood EDW is central data repository for all the 
applications which was consistently growing with new enhancements and 
data volume.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Analyzing the risks involved in migrating the data centers and server 
upgrades.
Assist in designing, planning and managing the data migration process 
Work with subject matter experts and project team to identify, define, 
collate, document and communicate the data migration requirements. 
Perform source system data analysis in order to manage source to 
target data mapping. 
Perform migration and testing of static data and transaction data from 
one core system to another. 
Perform data migration audit, reconciliation and exception reporting. 
Manage cross-program data assurance for physical data items in 
source and target systems. 
Developed APEX application and hosted it on AWS cloud to capture 
the internal metrics. 

RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for developing, support and maintenance for the ETL
(Extract,Transform and Load) processes using Informatica Power
Center 9.1. 
Worked on ETL and PL/SQL code Enhancements to provide the better 
functionality to the business user with proper coding standards. 
Prepared code migration document to move the mappings and PL/SQL
code from development to testing and then to production repositories. 
Parsed high-level design specification to simple ETL coding and
mapping standards. 
Attending daily scrum calls with stake holders.

I have extensive knowledge on creating custom overlay pins, plotting custom pins on a map and used Decoder to get the location address, zip code based on GPS location.

· TimedSMS for Android Platform
Description: TimedSMS is SMS scheduler application with loads features related to SMS scheduling, archiving, and effectively replacing the default SMS application that comes with Android devices. It allows
User to schedule SMS messages to be sent out anytime in the future which can also repeat on daily, weekly or monthly basis. There is no limit on the number of messages that can be scheduled and the messages can be scheduled for delivery to individual users or groups. The system SMS feature in timed SMS allows user to view message sent and received using default SMS application in a conversation style.
Vault features is particularly powerful as the user can define some contacts as vault contacts and all messages to vault contacts and moved to the vault and can only be accessed using password.
TimedSMS is available in the Android Market in Standard and Advanced version from Sep 10, 2010.
Team Members: 2 
Google Play Link:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=koeinnovations.timedSMSAdvanced&hl=en
Responsibilities/Highlights:

· Responsible for requirement analysis, design and development of all modules in this application.

· Presented & demonstrated end-to-end product functionality.

· VxRm for Android Platform
Description: VxRm is a popular application available for S60 and Windows Mobile devices which is being implemented for Android phone as part of this activity. The Android version has Phone call logging, meeting recording, voice recording and SMS backup options.

The meeting recording application features a proprietary audio buffering technology that buffers audio in a background audio buffer so that user can select the record key anytime and record the current discussion along with what has already been said earlier. 

All recorded files are automatically created in different folders intuitively named with the meeting name, date/time of meeting, date/time of recording and date time of the call. If automatic backup option is set, the files are emailed and removed from the device storage.
VxRm is available in the Android Market from Sep 7, 2010
Team Members: 2 
Google Play Link:

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=koeinnovations.vxrmstandard&hl=en
Responsibilities/Highlights:

· Responsible for requirement analysis, design, development and debugging of all modules in this application.

· Presented & demonstrated end-to-end product functionality.
· Smartsacts for Android Platform
Description: Smartacts application makes it possible for an owner of Android devices share the devices with multiple users, users who are either too young to use a mobile phone or to be able to find their ways in using the phone. It also restrict the user as to who they can Call/SMS and also who can Call/SMS them when the devices is with them.
While the initial version of Smartacts was as an end user application, subsequently a Smartacts server was implemented and the Smartacts Android device application was server enabled. In the server enabled version, the configured pictures contacts are automatically uploaded to the Smartacts server and separately for the different mobile users and they are downloaded for the respective user when the user logs in.

All activities including the phone calls made, received, SMS messages sent and received are forwarded to the server for archival and optionally they are emailed to the owner of the devices.   
Smartacts is available in the Android Market from Sep 13, 2010.
Team Members: 2 
Google play Link:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=koeinnovations.smartactsstandard&hl=en
Responsibilities/Highlights:

· Responsible for requirement analysis, design, development and debugging of all modules in this application.

· Presented & demonstrated end-to-end product functionality.

Project I:

Project : Churn Analysis model

Objective : prediction on  churn customers.

Technologies : Hadoop server, R- Studio and Python

Roles and Responsibilities

 Gather the data to identify the customer behavior (1.5 million records and 60 variables)
 Identify the anomalies, missing values and outlier’s treatment 
 Used various techniques to treat the missing values and outliers. 
 Applied various transformation techniques to normalize the data.
 Created SMOT, Balanced data techniques (over sampling and under sampling) for classifying the data
 Applied the segmentation techniques to identify various patterns of customer behavior.
 Build the various machine learning model to choose the best model
 Created various cross validation techniques (Boot strapping and K-Fold techniques)
 Applied Ensemble methods to increase the accuracy of a model
 Created various metrics to check the model performance

Project II: 

Project :Exploratory Data analysis for Billing and Complaints Data

Objective : Identify the drivers for Billing and complaints data.

Technologies : Hadoop server, R- Studio and Python

Roles and Responsibilities:

 Identify the key metrics for Billing and complaints data (Usage information, Roaming information, network
information)

 Did data sanity check (Missing values and Outliers data)
 Created univariate analysis for all the key metrics
 Created various data patterns for Billing and complaints data
 Applied Cohort analysis to understand customer movement from month on month



 Identified relation between categorical variables by using Chi-Square test.
 Identified relation between numeric variables by using the correlation techniques
 Applied various Anova methods to finding relation between the variables
 Created multi variate analysis for few variables
 Generated reports for monthly and quarterly for all key metrics variables

Project III:

Project  : Delinquent customer analysis

Objective :  Prediction on delinquent customer

Technologies : Hadoop server, R- Studio and Python

Roles and Responsibilities:

 Gathered the 2.5 million records data along with 90 variables
 Created data patterns by using the key metrics are like Billing information and payment information 
 Applied Roll rate analysis to create the bad flag
 Did driver analysis to understand most important variables
 Built the logistic regression analysis to find who are likely to become as a delinquent 
 Created metrics are like Sensitivity, Specificity, Roc curve,AUC, F1 score, recall and precision 
 Applied rigid regression and lasso regression to regularize the coefficients 

Project IV:

Project: Next best offers for banking customers

Objective: Opportunity to analyze customer banking to detect opportunities for personal banker to cross
and up sell

Technologies : Hadoop server, R- Studio and Python

Roles and Responsibilities:

 Understanding the business problem and pulled information.
 Information in transactional systems needed to be pulled together and analyzed.
 2.7 million daily customers events.
 Building a predictive model to identify effective customers.
 Building a recommendation engine form a specific type of information filtering system techniques that

attempts to present information items that are likely of interest user 
 Validating a model by using cross validation methods are like grid search and boot strapping
 By using different validation metrics are like (KS Statistics, Gini , ROC curve , sensitivity, AUC, Somers D)
 Checking the model stability at testing phases and Out of time validation



 Built the various models to measure the model performance and model accuracy.

Project Summary

# Project1 :
Title
                    :  KeplerLake
Environment      : JAVA, Spring Boot, Spring Cloud ,Microservices Technology.
Client                      :  Intel Technology India Pvt. Ltd ,Bangalore
Duration                :  Oct 2018 to April 2019
Role
                   :  Senior Software Engineer
Team Size              :   6
Description:      

                      A System that provides a trusted execution environment to facilitate collaborative computation involving confidential data and software from different parties who want to share but not disclose their assets.
Roles & Responsibilities:
There are basically 5 components they are 

1)Central Function

2)Data Provider Gateway

3)Trust Orchestrator

4)Gluster Fs

5)Trust Execution Environment
· So I as a developer worked on Central Function component. In this component there are 3 services running i.e. OAuth(For Security),HTConder(job scheduler) ,Docker(Container).
